Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.progress

Interface ProgressReporter

All Superinterfaces:
Resettable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BroadcastingProgressReporter, ConcurrentBroadcastingProgressReporter
public interface ProgressReporter extends Resettable
Reports the progress of some operation to an end-user in some manner. The operation begins when start() is called and ends when end() is called. During the operation, each increment of progress can be reported with next() or next(Count). As the operation progresses, any ProgressListener that is registered via listener(ProgressListener) is called with the percent-complete.
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
See Also:
BroadcastingProgressReporter

    • isIndefinite

      default boolean isIndefinite()
      Returns:
      True if progress is indefinite because the number of steps in not known

    • listener

      default ProgressReporter listener​(ProgressListener listener)
      Calls a listener with the percent of progress each time it changes. This method is only called if steps() is larger than 0.

    • next

      void next()
      Report the next step in the operation. This is often fine-grained such as processing a single node or way in a data file. The implementation in BroadcastingProgressReporter of this interface is designed to be efficient in this way.

    • next

      default void next​(Count steps)
      Report progress of the given number of steps towards completion
